pullRequest.body:
Shows that any object in a Galois category is the sum of its connected components. Also shows that the connected components are unique up to isomorphism.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #10400
- [x] depends on: #10418

This will be used in the followup PR to show that the fiber of any object is represented by a Galois object, which essentially shows the pro-representability of fiber functors.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Canceled.
I don't know why the build keeps failing, I just merged master, maybe that helps. Could someone send this to bors again?

Let me try again
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7897952274/job/21554410147)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7897952274/job/21554409710)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7897952274/job/21554409997)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Small comment. I'll review the big file later.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Does this work
```suggestion
  contrapose! hc
  exact ⟨hi, fun Y i hm hni ↦ hc Y hni i hm⟩
```
Indeed, this works! I did not know the `!` option, that is quite neat.

```suggestion
morphisms indexed by `ι₁ ⊕ ι₂` -/
```
The two declarations you've put in this namespace probably belong in another file.
I don't know if it should be a new file or an existing one, but it's too general for this file.
I agree, I don't know where to put them though (the reason why I ultimately left them here).
Did you try #find_home?

Yes, but the result is this file :/ I had some discussions on this with @joelriou here: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Combine.20coproducts

Ideally one could build a suitably general API for combining cofans, which in theory already exists with the `GradedObject` API. In practice though, using this API amounts to showing some cocone categories are isomorphic in every applied situation which turns out to be longer than just reproving the colimit property (as its done here).

I would be fine with creating a new file `CombinedProducts.lean` in the `Limits.Shapes` folder and to collect specialized helpers like this one there. We could also put the one posted in the linked Zulip chat above for Sigma types.

"When in doubt, create a new file"

(I just made this up, but it sounds true :grinning:)
I created a `CombinedProducts.lean` and added the version for `Fan`s. In a followup PR I can add other similar constructors floating around in the mentioned Zulip stream.

One might want to refactor the file structure to move `Products.lean` to `Products/Basic.lean` and move the `CombinedProducts.lean` into that folder. If this is wanted, I can do it, but suggest do it after this PR is merged, to not obfuscate the diff.

To avoid repetition of this sort of `obtain` in the future, could you put a definition `GaloisCategory.getFiberFunctor` (which gives the `F`) and an instance `FiberFunctor GaloisCategory.getFiberFunctor`, in the `Basic` file?

```suggestion
  exact ⟨ι, hf, f, colimit.isoColimitCocone ⟨Cofan.mk X g, hl⟩, hc⟩
```

```suggestion
  obtain ⟨⟨j⟩, z, h⟩ := Concrete.isColimit_exists_rep _ s' x
  refine ⟨f j, g j, z, ⟨?_, hc j, MonoCoprod.mono_inj _ (Cofan.mk X g) hl j⟩⟩
  subst h
  rfl
```
Instead of using variables `X₁`, `g₁`, etc, it would be better to have a variable `c₁ : Cofan f₁` and `h₁ : IsColimit c₁`. A general `BinaryCofan` instead of a `BinaryCofan.mk` would also be better.
Thanks! Any suggestion on where to put this?

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion # Constructors for combining (co)fans ```
